WHO ARE FORCED HEIRS
(1) The following are forced heirs: a deceased person's descendants, adoptive children and their descendants, his or her parents, and his or her spouse.
(2) The deceased person's grandfathers and grandmothers and his or her brothers and sisters shall be forced heirs only when they are permanently incapacitated for work and have no necessary means of subsistence.
(3) The persons mentioned in this Article shall be forced heirs when they are entitled to inheritance in accordance with the law of succession.
